column1: Firs were Evergreen trees that grew across the northern parts of Middle-earth
column2: and especially in the upper Vales of Anduin.  On 23 September  Frodo Baggins
column4: and Peregrin Took encountered firs at midnight in the Green Hill Country.  The hobbits made a fire of fir sticks and cones and slept in angles between a great fir-trees roots.
